Which state has become the first to ban the abortion pill?
Wyoming
When does the medication abortion ban go into effect?
July 1
What is the penalty for violating the medication abortion ban?
Up to six months' imprisonment and a fine of up to $9,000
What are the exemptions from the medication abortion ban?
Sexual assault, incest, natural miscarriage, and procedures for imminent peril that substantially endangers a pregnant person's life or health
Which medication is exempted from the ban?
Plan B One-Step and other morning-after pills
Is the pregnant person exempt from prosecution for their own abortion?
Yes
How many states have some restriction on medication abortion?
Fifteen
What is the name of the only abortion clinic in Wyoming?
Women’s Health & Family Care Clinic
Which case caused several states to push forward anti-abortion measures?
The Supreme Court's overturn of Roe v. Wade
What percentage of abortions in the United States is medication abortion estimated to account for?
More than half
